verses.kjv: In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And the prophet Isaiah the son of Amoz came to him, and said unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Set thine house in order; for thou shalt die, and not live.
verses.web: In those days Hezekiah was sick and dying. Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz came to him, and said to him, “LORD says, ‘Set your house in order; for you will die, and not live.’ ”
verses.ct: During that time, Hezekiah became deathly ill. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz came to him and said, "This is what the LORD says: 'Get your affairs in order, because you are going to die. You won't recover from this.'"

verses.kjv: Then he turned his face to the wall, and prayed unto the LORD, saying,
verses.web: Then he turned his face to the wall, and prayed to LORD, saying,
verses.ct: Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall and prayed to the LORD.

verses.kjv: I beseech thee, O LORD, remember now how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore.
verses.web: “Remember now, LORD, I beg you, how I have walked before you in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in your sight.” And Hezekiah wept bitterly.
verses.ct: "Please, LORD, remember how I have lived my life faithfully before you with a wholehearted devotion, and how I have done what is good in your sight." Then Hezekiah broke down and wept bitterly.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, afore Isaiah was gone out into the middle court, that the word of the LORD came to him, saying,
verses.web: Before Isaiah had gone out into the middle part of the city, LORD’s word came to him, saying,
verses.ct: Before Isaiah had even left the middle courtyard, the word of the LORD came to him:

verses.kjv: Turn again, and tell Hezekiah the captain of my people, Thus saith the LORD, the God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears: behold, I will heal thee: on the third day thou shalt go up unto the house of the LORD.
verses.web: “Turn back, and tell Hezekiah the prince of my people, ‘LORD, the God of David your father, says, “I have heard your prayer. I have seen your tears. Behold, I will heal you. On the third day, you will go up to LORD’s house.
verses.ct: "Go back and tell Hezekiah, the leader of my people, 'This is what the LORD, the God of your ancestor David, says: I have heard your prayer. I have seen your tears. I am going to heal you. On the third day, you will go up to the house of the LORD.'"

verses.kjv: And I will add unto thy days fifteen years; and I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria; and I will defend this city for mine own sake, and for my servant David’s sake.
verses.web: I will add to your days fifteen years. I will deliver you and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria. I will defend this city for my own sake, and for my servant David’s sake.” ’ ”
verses.ct: "I will add 15 years to your life. I will rescue you and this city from the king of Assyria. I will defend this city for my own sake and for the sake of my servant David."

verses.kjv: And Isaiah said, Take a lump of figs. And they took and laid it on the boil, and he recovered.
verses.web: Isaiah said, “Take a cake of figs.” They took and laid it on the boil, and he recovered.
verses.ct: Isaiah said, "Prepare a paste of figs." So they made one and applied it to the infected sore, and Hezekiah recovered.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah said unto Isaiah, What shall be the sign that the LORD will heal me, and that I shall go up into the house of the LORD the third day?
verses.web: Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “What will be the sign that LORD will heal me, and that I will go up to LORD’s house the third day?”
verses.ct: Hezekiah asked Isaiah, "What sign will the LORD give me to confirm that he will heal me and that I'll go up to the house of the LORD on the third day?"

verses.kjv: And Isaiah said, This sign shalt thou have of the LORD, that the LORD will do the thing that he hath spoken: shall the shadow go forward ten degrees, or go back ten degrees?
verses.web: Isaiah said, “This will be the sign to you from LORD, that LORD will do the thing that he has spoken: should the shadow go forward ten steps, or go back ten steps?”
verses.ct: Isaiah replied, "The LORD will give you this sign to prove he will do what he promised: would you like the shadow on the stairway to move forward 10 steps, or go backward 10 steps?"

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah answered, It is a light thing for the shadow to go down ten degrees: nay, but let the shadow return backward ten degrees.
verses.web: Hezekiah answered, “It is a light thing for the shadow to go forward ten steps. No, but let the shadow return backward ten steps.”
verses.ct: Hezekiah answered, "It's easy enough for the shadow to move forward 10 steps — that happens naturally. No, make the shadow go backward 10 steps instead."

verses.kjv: And Isaiah the prophet cried unto the LORD: and he brought the shadow ten degrees backward, by which it had gone down in the dial of Ahaz.
verses.web: Isaiah the prophet cried to LORD; and he brought the shadow ten steps backward, by which it had gone down on the sundial of Ahaz.
verses.ct: So Isaiah the prophet called out to the LORD, and the LORD made the shadow move backward 10 steps on the stairway of Ahaz, reversing the distance it had already traveled down.

verses.kjv: At that time Berodachbaladan, the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present unto Hezekiah: for he had heard that Hezekiah had been sick.
verses.web: At that time Berodach Baladan the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah; for he had heard that Hezekiah had been sick.
verses.ct: Around that time, Berodachbaladan son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a gift to Hezekiah because he had heard about his illness.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah hearkened unto them, and shewed them all the house of his precious things, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the precious ointment, and all the house of his armour, and all that was found in his treasures: there was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah shewed them not.
verses.web: Hezekiah listened to them, and showed them all the storehouse of his precious things, the silver, the gold, the spices, and the precious oil, and the house of his armor, and all that was found in his treasures. There was nothing in his house, or in all his dominion, that Hezekiah didn’t show them.
verses.ct: Hezekiah welcomed the envoys and gave them a full tour of his treasure house — the silver, the gold, the spices, the precious oils, his entire armory, and everything stored in his vaults. There wasn't a single thing in his palace or anywhere in his kingdom that Hezekiah didn't show them.

verses.kjv: Then came Isaiah the prophet unto king Hezekiah, and said unto him, What said these men? and from whence came they unto thee? And Hezekiah said, They are come from a far country, even from Babylon.
verses.web: Then Isaiah the prophet came to king Hezekiah, and said to him, “What did these men say? From where did they come to you?” Hezekiah said, “They have come from a far country, even from Babylon.”
verses.ct: Then the prophet Isaiah came to King Hezekiah and asked, "What did those men say, and where did they come from?" Hezekiah answered, "They came from a distant land — from Babylon."

verses.kjv: And he said, What have they seen in thine house? And Hezekiah answered, All the things that are in mine house have they seen: there is nothing among my treasures that I have not shewed them.
verses.web: He said, “What have they seen in your house?” Hezekiah answered, “They have seen all that is in my house. There is nothing among my treasures that I have not shown them.”
verses.ct: Isaiah asked, "What did they see in your palace?" Hezekiah replied, "They saw everything. There's nothing in my treasuries that I didn't show them."

verses.kjv: And Isaiah said unto Hezekiah, Hear the word of the LORD.
verses.web: Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear LORD’s word.
verses.ct: Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, "Listen to the word of the LORD:

verses.kjv: Behold, the days come, that all that is in thine house, and that which thy fathers have laid up in store unto this day, shall be carried into Babylon: nothing shall be left, saith the LORD.
verses.web: ‘Behold, the days come that all that is in your house, and that which your fathers have laid up in store to this day, will be carried to Babylon. Nothing will be left,’ says LORD.
verses.ct: "'The time is coming when everything in your palace — everything your ancestors have stored up until today — will be carried off to Babylon. Nothing will be left,' says the LORD.

verses.kjv: And of thy sons that shall issue from thee, which thou shalt beget, shall they take away; and they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.
verses.web: ‘They will take away some of your sons who will issue from you, whom you will father; and they will be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.’ ”
verses.ct: "'Some of your own descendants, your own flesh and blood, will be taken away and made to serve as eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.'"

verses.kjv: Then said Hezekiah unto Isaiah, Good is the word of the LORD which thou hast spoken. And he said, Is it not good, if peace and truth be in my days?
verses.web: Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “LORD’s word which you have spoken is good.” He said moreover, “Isn’t it so, if peace and truth will be in my days?”
verses.ct: Hezekiah responded to Isaiah, "The word of the LORD that you've spoken is good." Then he added, "At least there will be peace and stability during my lifetime."

verses.kjv: And the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and all his might, and how he made a pool, and a conduit, and brought water into the city, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and all his might, and how he made the pool, and the conduit, and brought water into the city, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.ct: Everything else about Hezekiah's reign — all his accomplishments, and how he built the pool and the tunnel to bring water into the city — is recorded in the official history of Judah's kings.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah slept with his fathers: and Manasseh his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Hezekiah slept with his fathers, and Manasseh his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Hezekiah died and was buried with his ancestors, and his son Manasseh became king after him.
